item.title: The UK will start feeding lab-grown meat to pets this year
item.description:
The UK is now the first European country to green-light the sale of lab-grown meat, but with pets instead of human consumers as its first guinea pigs.

The UK’s Animal and Plant Health Agency and the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs granted London-based startup Meatly regulatory approval to produce lab-grown pet food, which described the clearance as a “huge leap forward for the cultivated meat industry.”

“Pet parents are crying out for a better way to feed their cats and dogs meat,” Meatly CEO Owen Ensor said in a statement, pitching that the company’s cultivated pet food would allow them to do so “in a way that is kinder to our planet and other animals.”

Meatly says it plans to launch commercial samples of its first...

Continue reading…

item.title: U.S. and Saudi Arabia sign agreement for joint space exploration and research
item.description: Saudi Arabia has been investing in research and partnerships in recent years with the aim of growing its capabilities in the space sector.

item.title: Elon Musk says he's moving SpaceX, X headquarters from California to Texas - Phys.org
item.description:
1. Elon Musk says he's moving SpaceX, X headquarters from California to Texas  Phys.org

  3. Elon Musk moves SpaceX and X to Texas because California is too supporting of trans youth  Advocate.com
  4. Newsom to Musk after HQs move announcement: ‘You bent the knee’  The Hill
  5. After California approves pro-transgender measure, Elon Musk says he will move companies' headquarters  Yahoo! Voices
